<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Reanimator Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=3486) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Book of the Dead](/Sources.aspx?ID=118) pg. 34</row>

**Archetype** [Reanimator](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=175)

**Prerequisites**
able to cast [_animate dead_](/Spells.aspx?ID=666) with a spell slot

</column>

---

You have dedicated your studies to the art of raising and commanding undead. If you're a spontaneous spellcaster with _animate dead_ in your repertoire, it becomes a signature spell in addition to your usual signature spells. If you're a prepared spellcaster with _animate dead_ in your spells known, spellbook, or the like, you can spend 10 minutes contemplating undeath to replace one of the spells you've prepared in your spell slots with an animate dead spell of the same level. In addition, if you're able to target the mostly intact remains of an appropriate type of dead creature when casting _animate dead_, the undead you animate gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, AC, saving throws, and skill checks for the duration of _animate dead_.

**Special** You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the reanimator archetype.

<title level="2">Reanimator Dedication leads to...</title>
[Bonds of Death](/Feats.aspx?ID=3489), [Deathly Secrets](/Feats.aspx?ID=3487), [Macabre Virtuoso](/Feats.aspx?ID=3488)
